1.content:
The peaceful evening on the 7th floor of a luxury Miami condominium was suddenly shattered by the sounds of screams coming from one of the units. A few concerned neighbors went to investigate but stopped when they realized where it was coming from. Dominic Harrison and his fiancé, Rebecca Northam, had been fighting a lot lately. This was just another in a long line of fights for them.

Dominic was standing in the kitchen, trying to make some pasta, when Rebecca feverishly entered the room with a suitcase. “I can’t believe you’d do this without asking me about it first.”

Rebecca was leaving for a conference in New York; Dominic thought now would’ve been a proper time to tell her that his parents were coming to dinner next week. “I don’t see what the big deal is, they’re my parents.”

Leaning the suitcase against the wall, trying her best to remain calm, Rebecca turned to Dominic and said, “Your parents hate me, Dom; every time they see me, they treat me like I’m some spoiled rich girl.”

Rebecca’s family was one of the wealthier families in south Florida, due in large part to their company, Northam Technologies. Rebecca and her sister Grace had been groomed from a young age for jobs in the company after college; Rebecca was in Public Relations, while Grace was in her sophomore year of college. Dominic's parents knew of this, but felt that it was nothing short of nepotism; whereas Dominic had worked his way up from the bottom to become a senior analyst in the IT department. “Inviting them to dinner is the best way to change their minds.”

“Please; they’ll just find some other reason to hate me.” Looking at the clock, Rebecca said, “Look, I-I’ve got to go; promise me you won’t make any more unilateral decisions without talking to me first?”

“I promise.” Walking over to kiss her, Dominic said, “Have fun at the conference.”

***************************************


Rebecca was driving down I-95 towards the airport when her phone started ringing. A quick glance at the dash display showed Dad. Groaning, she begrudgingly answered the call, “Hi Dad.”

“Hi sweetie, just calling to check in before your flight.” Pausing, he said, “Is everything alright, you don’t sound happy.”

After losing their mother at an early age, Harold had made certain that he was always there for his daughters. This, in time, led him to know exactly when something was bothering them. “I’m fine, Dad; it’s just...Dominic and I were arguing.”

Rebecca could hear her father’s sigh over the phone; much like Dominic’s parents didn’t like her, Harold didn’t care for Dominic.
“What did he do this time?”

“He invited his parents for dinner next week without asking me about it first.” Sighing, Rebecca said, “He said it would help them to change their opinion about me.”

Harold was fully aware of the Harrison’s opinion of his daughter. She expected him to agree with her, but instead he said, “I can’t believe I’m saying this, but Dominic is right; a dinner might be just the thing to make them come around.”

“That’s funny coming from you; you telling me to do the one thing you’ve refused to do for two years.” Pausing, Rebecca said, “I’ll take that under advisement if you’re willing to do the same.”

Harold realized he’d just backed himself into a corner; what kind of parent would tell his kids to do something, and then refuse to do it himself. Looking at the window of his home office, he said, “Fine, why don’t we make plans for the 3 of us to have dinner in a few weeks.”

“That works with me; although I’m sure Dominic will need some convincing.”

“I’m sure he’ll come around. But, “pausing, Harold said, “As for the other thing, if you want I can stop by tomorrow and have a talk with him.”

“I appreciate the offer, Dad; but I doubt anything you say will get through.” Taking the ramp towards the airport, Rebecca said, “I’m almost to the airport, I should probably hang up.”

“Enjoy the conference, sweetie; and don’t worry about Dominic.” Pausing, Harold said, “I’ll have a talk with him tomorrow.”
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
With Rebecca gone for the next few days, and no work until tomorrow, Dominic decided to stay in and relax. While waiting for the water to boil so he could make some spaghetti, Dominic took the elevator down to the lobby to retrieve the mail. He found himself thinking about his argument with Rebecca during the elevator ride down; wondering if perhaps she was right, and he should’ve discussed dinner with his parents first.

Stepping out of the elevator into the lobby, he walked towards the wall of mailboxes just as a trio of teenage girls walking down the stairs from the second floor. They were wearing the clingy, form fitting clothes typical of today’s teenage girls; they were all laughing at something on one girl’s phone as they walked by. That brought Dominic back to his high school days, wondering if they were laughing at him. Don't be silly, Dominic, he told himself, High School was a long time ago.

Dominic went back upstairs to the apartment and, after checking to see if the water was boiling, he sat down to go through the mail. He was putting Rebecca’s aside so she could look at it when she got back; although the cover of one of her women’s magazines caught his attention. Looking closer, he saw it was a woman he remembered fantasizing about when he was in high school. For someone whose pushing 40, she still looks great.” looking at the magazine some more, he thought, I wonder what her secret is?

All of this rememcising about High School prompted Dominic to look back at his old yearbooks. Unlike most of his classmates, his was almost completely devoid of signatures. Chalk it up to a youth spent alone. Life hadn’t changed much in the 8 years since High School; then, as now, he still wasn’t one of the cool people.

What I wouldn't give for the chance to turn my life around, he thought. Imagine Rebecca's reaction to coming home and finding me a changed person.
11.title: Alone In The Apartment

111.content:
Harold arrived that the Northam Technologies headquarters early the next morning, desperate to set his plan in motion before Dominic arrived. After putting his briefcase in his office, Harold made his way down to the labs on the 5th floor.

Northam Technologies had subsidiaries in almost every industry, so it wouldn’t be difficult for Harold to find something to carry out his plan. His plan was comparatively simple; Dominic was stubborn enough to where Harold knew he wouldn’t listen to him, so Harold planned to forcibly change Dominic’s attitude.

Walking into one of the labs, he was pleasantly surprised to see a lab technician sitting at a nearby desk at such an early hour. Going up to him, Harold said, “Excuse me, young man; can you tell me of any current projects involving behavior modification?”

If the technician, a young man perhaps a few years behind Dominic, had any concerns as to what was going on, he didn’t voice them. “Of course, sir; we’re not really working on anything like that at the moment.” Pausing, he said, “The closest thing I can think is something we’re calling XP-3; it’s something we’re working on to improve upon a person’s less desirable personality traits.”

Harold was surprised; he had no idea something to that effect was possible outside of hypnosis. “How does this XP-3 work, exactly?”

“I’m afraid I don’t have the information on hand right now.” Getting up, the technician said, “If you want, I can gather some information and deliver it to your office?”

“Sure, why don’t you do that.”

“I’ll have the information on your desk in a few hours, sir; in the meantime, if you’ll excuse me, I have to use the bathroom.”
Harold waited until after he heard the bathroom door close; once he was sure there was no one around, he walked over to a freezer and opened it. It didn’t take long for him to find a vial labeled XP-3. With a grin on his face, he pocketed the file and left the room.

*****************


The lab technician returned a few minutes later to find that Harold had left; he was about to get back to work when another technician entered the room. “Hey Tommy, the results from the latest XP-3 trials came back.” Pausing, she said, “I think we’ve narrowed down why of the mice experienced such drastic shifts in personality.”

The lab had run a test on XP-3 a few days earlier; during which time several of the test mice started acting counter to the way they normally would. A normally docile and submissive male became aggressive and dominant; a female became sexually aggressive towards a younger male. Looking at his associate, the lab tech said, “What did you find?”

“The mice experiencing the personality shifts had, for some unknown reason, large amounts of caffeine in their systems.” Walking past her coworker, the tech said, “I guess for now, we make sure not to mix XP-3 with caffeine.”
111.title: A Plan Set In Motion

1111.content:
Dominic arrived at work shortly before 7:30 that morning; walking into the elevator lobby as he left a voicemail for Rebecca asking her to give him a call. He figured the chances of her calling back were slim, but he didn’t see the harm in trying.

As he walked through the doorway of the IT Department, he saw his coworker Marci Collins sitting at her desk. Dominic’s close relationship with Marci was a frequent cause of disagreement between him and Rebecca as she didn’t like how close the two of them were. Every time she brought that up, Dominic had to remind her that Marci was a lesbian and had a wife.

Taking a seat at the desk across from hers, Dominic said, “Hey Marci, how was your weekend?”

“Oh you know; pretty much the same as always.” Placing a hand on her baby bump, Marci said, “Kelly and I are still trying to choose a name for our unborn son; but we can’t seem to agree on anything.”

“I tell you, I’d gladly argue about something like that instead of what happened last night.” Sighing, seeing the concerned look on Marci’s face, Dominic said, “I told Rebecca that my parents were taking us to dinner next week; and she didn’t like that I agreed to it with consulting her.”

“I guess I can see where she’s coming from; if you guys are going to be married, you both have to stop making unilateral decisions without the other. But,” reaching for some paper on her desk, Marci said, “The marriage will be a lot smoother if your parents get along with your fiancé.”

As if on cue, Harold entered the room at that moment. Walking towards them, he said, “Ms. Collins, can I have a moment alone with Dominic?”

“Sure thing, Mr. Northam.” Quickly glancing at her computer, Marci said, “But don’t take too long; we just got a service request in a lab on the 6th floor.”

Once Marci was out of the room, Dominic turned to look at Harold and said, “What can I do for you, Harold?”

“Please call me Mr. Northam; you’re not married to my daughter yet, so you haven’t earned that right.” Sighing, Harold said,
“Rebecca called me last night; told me about your little fight.”

“Great; let me guess, you’re going to yell at me too?”

“No, not exactly; as strange as it sounds, I actually found myself on your side.” Pausing, Harold said, “If she’s going to be a member of your family, Rebecca will need to get to know your parents better.”

“That’s what I said, but she wouldn’t listen.” Taking a breath, Dominic said, “I suppose you’re not here just to say that, are you?”

“You’re correct, it’s not.” Sitting on Dominic’s desk, Harold said, “As much as Rebecca needs to, you need to make some changes as well. You need to take Rebecca’s feelings into account before making decisions like agreeing to dinner with your folks.”

“How exactly am I going to do that, sir? I love Rebecca very much, but she can be pretty stubborn at times.”

“I raised her and her sister by myself, I know how stubborn she can be.” Sighing, Harold said, “Just try to be more open to her feelings, okay?”

“Yes sir.” Getting up, Dominic said, “Now if you don’t mind, I need to get my things and head to the 6th floor.”

Harold waited until Dominic and Marci were out of sight; reaching into his pocket, he pulled out the small vial that held the XP-3.
Opening the top, he poured the contents into Dominic’s coffee mug. Once the vial was empty, he pocketed it once more and got up to leave as Dominic reentered the room pushing a cart in front of him. After grabbing his laptop and coffee, Dominic left the room; unaware of what just happened.
1111.title: Starting the Work Day

11111.content:
Dominic stepped off the elevator on the 6th floor to find Marci waiting for him a short distance away. Taking a sip of his coffee as he walked up to her, Dominic said, “So what’s the problem exactly?”

“There’s been an ongoing issue with one of the decontamination showers; apparently it won’t open once a cycle is completed.” Walking next to Dominic as they went down the hall, Marci said, “Maintenance ruled out a mechanical failure, so that means it must be something wrong with the software.”

******************************


Marci and Dominic spent almost 45 minutes pouring over every line of code, checked every connection, and even replaced the computer controlling the doors. The whole time this was happening, Dominic found himself feeling unusually queasy. Looking at her friend, concerned, Marci said, “Hey, are you alright?”

“Yeah, I’m fine; I must’ve used some expired creamer in my coffee this morning.” Closing up the panel he was working on, Dominic said, “I think we’re all set; just need one of us to go inside and test it.”

Dominic was joking when he said that last part; he wasn’t going to risk putting Marci in a potentially dangerous, and embarrassing, situation. After stripping down to his boxers, Dominic entered the shower and signaled for Marci to start the cycle.

Dominic was suddenly hit with the worst cramps he’d ever experienced as if his insides were on fire. The shower had already started, so Marci wasn’t able to see him through the mist and steam. With no other options, he hit the panic button. Dominic’s pain grew exponentially worse as the alarms started blaring outside. It seemed to be spreading through his body. His last thoughts before losing consciousness were of Rebecca.

******************************


Marci was making a feeble attempt to open the door when the security team arrived a few minutes later. “What happened?”

Trying her best to stay calm, Marci barely managed to say, “I-I don’t know; all I heard was screaming followed by the panic alarm.”

Not wanting to break the glass, it took a few minutes for the crew to get the door open. Once they were inside, through the steam, they saw a figure lying prone on the floor. “Dominic, are you alright?”

The crews realized something was amiss when the steam cleared enough to reveal a _____.
11111.title: When Things Went Crazy

111111.content:
The lack of noise from the shower concerned Marci; as all sorts of scenarios started playing themselves out in her head. None of those scenarios, however, could prepare her for what happened next. From her location just outside the shower, Marci heard a strange voice say, “What the hell is going on here?”

It wasn’t what the voice said that gave Marci pause, it was the fact that it sounded like a teenage girl. Coming around the corner she saw the two guards, both with dumbfounded looks on their faces, staring at a nearly naked teenage girl. The poor girl’s face was red with embarrassment as she struggled to hold up an oversize pair of boxers with one hand and cover her chest with the other. “What’s going on?” in a state of confusion, Marci said, “Where’s Dominic?”

The teenage girl, still struggling to cover herself, looked at Marci and said, “I’m right here, Marci.” Sighing, she said, “You mind telling me why I’m suddenly a teenage girl?”
111111.title: Dominic, the teenage girl

1111111.content:
Once it became clear that nothing could be done for Dominic at the lab, the guards called for ambulance to take him and Marci to the hospital. The ride to the hospital was done in complete silence as neither of them knew what to say to the other. There were several times that Marci was tempted to reach over and comfort her friend only to decide that it wasn’t the proper time.

The ambulance dropped them off outside the ER, where a young doctor was waiting with an orderly and a wheelchair. The two were brought upstairs to a private room; Marci was about to follow when the doctor stopped her. “I’m sorry, miss; but you can’t come in here right now.”

There was no way Marci was going to leave Dominic alone right now; she was about to say that when Dominic beat her to the punch. “Please, doctor, I’d feel a lot better if she were in here with me.”

It was clear the doctor didn’t agree with it, but she realized she was outnumbered, “Fine, you can stay.” Sighing as she stepped aside, the doctor said, “Just stand in the corner and stay out of the way.”

*****************************


The doctor was very professional as she examined Dominic; she didn’t let her utter disbelief of the situation take over. She had Dominic explain everything that happened, with Marci filling it when needed.

After taking some blood for testing, the doctor walked over to the counter and put on a new pair of gloves. She then returned to the exam table where Dominic was lying in an inclined position. “Let me apologize in advance, Mr. Harrison, for what I’m about to do.” Moving a stool to the foot of the bed, the doctor said, “I wouldn’t be a good doctor if I wasn’t thorough, which, in this situation, means giving you a pelvic exam.”

It took a moment for the doctor’s words to hit home; but once they did, Dominic’s eyes went wide. “Hell no!” Jumping to the floor, Dominic ran behind the exam table, “There’s no way I’m letting you put anything up there.”

Exasperated, the doctor turned to Marci and said, “Perhaps you can talk some sense into him?”

Marci silently nodded before making her way behind the table. “Dom, listen to me; the doctor has to make sure that you’re healthy.”

“Yeah, well she can do that without sticking her fingers in my vagina.” Wincing, Dominic said, “God, I can’t believe I just said my vagina.”

“There are limits to what I can learn with a physical examination, Mr. Harrison.” Stepping forward, cautiously, the doctor said,
“You’ve got the body of 15-year-old girl; I need to make sure that certain parts of your anatomy are healthy.”

It was becoming clear to Dominic that he wasn’t getting out of this; and, in the back of his mind, he knew the doctor was right. If, god forbid, he was stuck like this he’d want to make sure he was healthy. “Okay fine.” Relenting, Dominic climbed back on the exam table, “Just make it quick, alright?”
1111111.title: At the Hospital

11111111.content:
Dominic wasn’t much in the mood for company after the pelvic exam; and Marci couldn’t really fault him for that. Once the doctor had finished the exam both her and Marci were politely, but firmly, asked to leave the room.

After sitting in the waiting room for a little while, Marci stood up and decided to check on Dominic. Walking down the hall, she knocked on the door and waited for a response, which she got in the form of, “Go away.”

Choosing to ignore that, Marci opened the door a crack and poked her inside to find Dominic sitting on the bed in the fetal position. Poor guy, she thought, this must be incredibly awkward for him. Walking up to the bed, Marci said, “Hey Dom, how are you doing?”

“I’m doing just great, Marci.” With an exasperated sigh, Dominic said, “First I have a massive argument with my fiancé; then I, somehow, get turned into a 15-year-old girl.”

“I’m here for you, okay?” Taking a seat next to Dominic, Marci said, “I’ll try to help you get through this.”

“Sorry; but how exactly are you going to do that?” looking at Marci, giving her one of those ‘are you serious, right now’ facial expressions, Dominic said, “Unless I missed something over the last 3 years, when did your gender suddenly change?”

Well, he’s got me there. Placing a sympathetic arm on Dominic’s shoulder, Marci said, “I mean; I know what it’s like to be a 15-year-old girl, so I can help you in that regard.”

“I guess, with Rebecca not here, you’re the best option I have.” Resting his head on Marci’s shoulder, Dominic said, “What’s the first thing on the list?”

“Once the doctors say you can leave, I was thinking we’d take you to the mall and buy some clothes.” Gesturing to the nearby bag holding Dominic’s clothes, she said, “No offense; but that’s not an outfit for a 15-year-old girl.”

“I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to get some new clothes; especially since I have no clue if this is permanent.” Looking up at Marci, Dominic said, “Besides; you can help me pick out clothes to draw attention from both guys and girls.”

Marci thought that was an uncharacteristic comment for Dominic to make; but before she could speak up about it, the door opened at Harold walked into the room.
11111111.title: Marci Checks on Dominic

111111111.content:
Had Harold not been told what happened, he never would’ve guess the young girl sitting on the hospital bed was once a 26-year-old man. The girl bared a passing resemblance to Dominic; she could’ve passed for a younger sister. Her brown hair was a few shades darker than Dominic’s, while also going just passed her shoulders. Harold also noticed she was far more developed then his daughters and their friends had been at that age.

Harold couldn’t shake the feeling that he was responsible for Dominic’s current situation. After getting over his initial shock, he cautiously approached the bed and said, “How are you feeling, Dominic?”

“Oh I’m just peachy, boss.” With an exasperated sigh, Dominic said, “I just figured I’d stop by the hospital for no reason at all.”

While both Marci and Harold were taken aback by Dominic’s response, Harold himself was particularly shocked. It was true the two of them didn’t have the best relationship, but Dominic never spoke to him that way before. Harold couldn’t shake the feeling that he was acting like an insolent teenager. He had experience in that regard; having raised two teenage girls as a single father.

The room was steeped in silence as no one knew what to say next. Thankfully the doctor chose that moment to walk in, breaking the tension in the room. Spotting Harold as she closed the door, the doctor said, “Who are you?”

“I’m Harold Northam; as implausible it may sound, this young lady is my employee.” Focusing on the doctor, Harold said, “What exactly can you tell us?”

“Not much, I’m afraid; nothing like this has ever happened before.” Looking at her clipboard, the doctor continued, “For all intents and purposes Mr. Harrison is now a normal, healthy, 15-year-old girl. It honestly wouldn’t surprise me in the least if he started menstruating soon.”

While Harold and Marci were genuinely shocked by that statement, Dominic looked as though he could care less. He just lay in bed, his head resting against the pillow, as he stared blankly at the wall in front of him. “Excuse me, Doctor; but how is that possible?” with a gesture towards Dominic, Marci said, “This morning Dom was a grown man, now you’re telling us he’s possibly days away from having a period?”

“I’m as confused as you are, Ms. Collins; like I said, nothing like this has happened before.” Sighing, the doctor said, “There’s no denying the fact that your friend is now biologically female in every way.”

While Marci went to comfort an emotionless Dominic, Harold pulled the doctor aside and said, “Is there anything you can tell us about what may have caused this?”

“I can’t know for certain, but the blood tests showed an unknown chemical in his bloodstream; that could be responsible for what we’re seeing here.” Turning back to Dominic, the doctor said, “Mr. Harrison, did you eat or drink anything unusual this morning?”

“No, not really; unless you count a Dunkin Donuts coffee that had a weird taste to it.” Looking up at the doctor, Dominic said, “I highly doubt a $4 cup of coffee is responsible for making me female.”

While Harold turned pale, the doctor said, “I’m inclined to agree with you; but I can’t rule anything out right now.”

“So what happens to me in the meantime?” with a sigh, Dominic said, “Forgive me, but I’m not a big fan of hospitals; so, if it’s alright with you, I’d like to go home now.”

“I have no reason to keep you here, Mr. Harrison; whatever was responsible for this isn’t contagious, otherwise we all probably would’ve been affected by now.” With a smile, the doctor said, “I’ll keep you informed of anything that I find.”

Dominic waited until the doctor left before jumping out of bed and retrieved his clothes; which were now at least 4 sizes too big. As he turned to head off to the bathroom, Harold said, “Try to keep a positive attitude about this, Dominic; for all you know, this could be temporary.”

“I wish I shared your optimism, Mr. Northam; but I’m a 15 year old girl now.” Reaching out to open the bathroom door, Dominic said, “Last time I checked, the only cure for that was turning 16."
111111111.title: The Doctor Visits With An Update

1111111111.content:
Harold and Marci sat outside the room for 20 minutes while Dominic was inside getting dressed. The two of them passed the time exchanging idle chit-chat, but nothing too serious. Eventually the waiting proved too much for Harold, so he stood up and started towards the closed door. “I’m going to check on Dominic; see what’s taking him so long.”

Getting to her feet, Marci got between Harold and the door faster than he’d ever seen a pregnant woman move. “No sir, you’re not going in there.”

Even considering the situation they found themselves in, Harold didn’t like it when an employee spoke to him like that. Taking a step back, he looked at Marci and said, “And why not?”

“We have to give Dominic as much time as he needs; no one’s ever experienced anything close to this before, so he’s bound to be a little...curious. Beside,” her face turning serious, Marci continued, “Do you really want to explain to hospital security, and possibly the police, why you were alone in a room with a naked 15 year old girl?”

The look on Harold’s face turned to sheer dread as he realized what Marci was saying. Harold had mistakenly walked in on Grace and Rebecca when they were growing up; as angry as they were, he couldn’t imagine how angry Dominic would’ve been. “Y-You’re right; I-I don’t want that.”

It wasn’t much longer before the sound of footsteps and a turning door handle drew their attention back towards the door. They watched as an apprehensive-looking teenage girl stepped out into the hallway. Both Marci and Harold had to stifle a chuckle at the sight before them, as Dominic’s clothes were much too big for a teenage girl. Scratching his scalp, Dominic looked at them and said, “What do you guys think?”

Harold and Marci exchanged looks, neither of them knew how to respond. After a moment, Harold finally said, “You look...nice, Dominic.”

Neither of them was sure how to respond; Harold finally said, “You look...nice, Dominic.”

“I know these clothes don’t exactly fit me right now; but it’s not like I’ve got a lot of options here.” Focusing on them, with a wry smile, Dominic said, “All things considered, I think I make a good looking 15-year-old girl. Right?”

While she and Harold silently nodded in agreement, Marci was growing concerned by Dominic’s new nonchalant attitude. She’d be freaking out if this happened to her; but here he was, acting like it was nothing. “Hey Dom, I’m glad you’re healthy and all that; but you’re surprisingly calm about all this.”

As the three of them started walking towards the elevator, Dominic said, “I’m pretty sure that’s only temporary; I’ll probably start freaking out once the shock wears off.” Looking at Marci as they walked, he said, “Now, if I remember correctly, you mentioned something about shopping?”

In all the excitement, Marci had completely forgotten that she’d said that. “If that’s what you want to do, then I’m more than willing to take you.” As she pushed the elevator button, Marci continued, “I just hope you know you’re ready for this; shopping for girls is way different than shopping for boys.”

During the elevator ride down, Harold said, "I have to return to the office, but I'll drop you two off at the mall on the way." looking at Marci, he said, "I'll make sure to reimburse you for whatever you end up buying."
1111111111.title: Waiting for Dominic

11111111111.content:
Due to late morning traffic, it was a 25-minute drive to the mall; Harold drove while Marci sat in the back seat with Dominic, discussing the finer points of teenage fashion. It was clear the subject was making Dominic uncomfortable, so Marci eventually said, “Don’t worry Dom; I won’t force you to wear anything you’d be uncomfortable in.”

“Sounds good to me.” Without turning away from the window, Dominic said, “I just want the boys to turn their heads, not try and force themselves on me.”

It took everything for Harold not to slam on the breaks in the middle of the highway as he spun around to look at Marci. “What did he just say?”

Just as shocked as Harold, Marci turned her attention to Dominic; placing a hand on his shoulder as she said, “Dom, sweetie, are you alright?”

Turning away from the window, Dominic was silent for a moment. After an instant, he finally said, “Huh?”

“I asked if you were alright.” Growing more concerned, Marci said, “You mentioned something about turning boy’s heads at the mall.”

Dominic looked at Marci dumbfounded, “No I didn’t.”

“Uh, yes you did.” With a nervous chuckle, Marci said, “You said you wanted to turn heads, not have them force themselves on you.”

“Please, does that sound like something I’d say?” looking nervous, Dominic said, “I’ll have you know that I like boys...I mean girls.”

Harold quickly swerved into the breakdown lane and, after turning the car off, he looked in the back seat. “Something is clearly wrong with you, Dominic; perhaps we should take you back to the hospital.”

If they weren’t concerned about Dominic’s mental state, that all changed when he said, “No, I’m fine!” calming down ever so slightly, Dominic continued, “Now let’s just get me into some decent clothes before people start thinking I’m weird or something.”

Harold could’ve easily driven back to the hospital and Dominic, being technically a minor at this point, wouldn’t have been able to stop him. Turning towards the front again, Harold looked out the windshield at he decided his next move. After a moment of silence, he turned the car back on and drove back onto the highway. The exit for the mall was coming up which; which, if he turned left instead of right, would also return them to the hospital.

Driving off the highway, Harold slowed down ever so slightly as he decided his next move. With a heavy sigh, he sped up and turned _____.
11111111111.title: Driving to the Mall

111111111111.content:
Once he was alone in the dressing room, Dominic sat against the wall to compose himself. He’d been unable to, for whatever reason, voice his concerns outside; but, like Marci, he too was concerned about his sudden personality change. He always hated it when people, especially teenagers, used the word ‘like’ in sentences where it wasn’t needed; yet he’d used it several times in a brief period. Maybe Marci’s right: what if my appearance wasn’t the only thing changed?

Dominic shook those thoughts from his head; focusing instead on the problem at hand. Getting back to his feet, he stared at his reflection in the mirror: the long brown hair, the large breasts, the flat crotch. “God,” he said to himself, “It’s like I’m looking at totally different person.”

Maybe that’s because you are, a voice in his seemed to say.

Shaking his head only served to get him a face full of hair. I’ve really got do to something about this hair.

A new style might be nice.

There was that voice again; it was familiar, but Dominic couldn’t quite place it. Then it hit him – it was the same voice that’d been coming out of his mouth since he’d changed. Turning to look at the mirror, hoping there was no one nearby to hear him talking with himself, Dominic said, “You’re not me, are you?”

I think you mean that you’re not me; or did you really think this was your body?”

Dominic couldn’t shake the idea that he was going insane; so, to rid his mind of these thoughts, he tried in vain to think of something else. I suggest you leave before we call security.”

Emma was on the verge of relinquishing control back to Dominic; while Marci got angrier than she’d ever been before. “I’ll have you know she just went through a growth spurt.”

That explanation didn’t fly for the woman, as she focused on Marci’s baby bump. “You two must have awful parents; letting your sister dress like that while their other teenage daughter gets herself pregnant.”

Marci looked much younger than she really was; probably passing for 18 when she was really 25. The woman’s remarks did nothing to calm her down, if anything it made Marci even angrier. “Not that it’s any of your business; but I’m 25 years old.”

Amber and Emma could see where things were heading; it wasn’t going to be long before Marci and the woman were at each other’s throats. With the help of another co-worker, Amber got herself between Marci and the other woman. “Okay, let’s all just stay calm; last thing we want is a premature birth on our hands.” Turning her attention to the woman, Amber said, "Ma’am, I’m afraid this isn’t the first time we’ve heard complaints about your husband. I suggest you leave before we call security.”

The woman looked as though she was about to argue; until the security guards stepped out of the back with the store manager. Grabbing the other girl by the arm, she turned to her husband and said, “Let’s go Richard; we’ll buy Grace some bras at Sears.”

The other girl, Grace stood motionless for a moment as she gave Emma a look of pure dread. After hearing Amber mention this wasn’t the store’s first problem with Richard, Emma quickly realized he was probably doing the same to Grace as well. Before she could fully grasp what it was she was doing, Emma ran up to one of the guards. Pointing towards Richard, who was just about to leave the store, she said, “Excuse me sir, I think that man might be abusing that girl.”
111111111112111111.title: Trouble at Victoria's Secret

1111111111121111111.content:
The police must’ve been nearby because Emma watched from a nearby bench as half a dozen of them ran past them on the way to Victoria’s Secret. Things probably wouldn’t have escalated this far had Richard not taken a swing at one of the guards when the latter tried to grab for his phone.

Richard’s wife was trying her best to diffuse the situation; leaving the young girl to her own devices. Emma watched as she walked over and sat at a nearby bench. Getting it in her head that she should check on the girl, Emma got up and quietly walked over to her. As she got closer, Emma could tell that the girl was shaking and crying. “A-Are you alright?”

The girl took one look at Emma before getting to her feet and embracing her. The girl did nothing but cry into Emma’s shoulder for a solid five minutes. Emma was starting to feel a little uncomfortable when the girl softly, and between tears, said, “Thank you.”

Gently breaking the hug, Emma helped the girl sit down on the bench. Finding a discarded tissue in Dominic’s pants pocket, Emma handed it to the girl and said, “You want to talk about it?”

The girl introduced herself as Grace and said that Richard was her grandfather. Apparently he’d been behaving inappropriately towards her for years. She’d begged her parents not to make her spend the last week of summer vacation with her grandparents, but they wouldn’t listen. “This is probably going to sound awful. But,” looking at Emma, Grace said, “I’m glad my grandpa looked down your shirt.”

Emma was about to disagree with that, until she watched as Richard was led past them in handcuffs. If he hadn’t looked down her shirt then none of this would be happening. “I could’ve down without the creepy old guy look at my chest; but I’m glad your nightmare is over.”

Grace went back to crying for a few minutes as Emma realized that someone watching them from the second level of the mall. Looking up, she realized it was the girls from earlier watching the drama unfold. One of them, a brunette, gave Emma a smile and a nod before walking away with the others. A few more minutes went by before a young female officer approached them. “I’m Officer Sullivan; which one of you is Grace?”

It took all Emma's strength not to blurt out some witty response; instead she kept it in her head - Uh, I don’t know; maybe the one whose crying?

“That’s me.” Wiping tears from her eyes, Grace said, “What’s going to happen now?”

Emma decided to give them some privacy; walking away as Officer Sullivan sat down. The last thing she heard was her telling Grace they were going to the station for her statement. Looking around for a moment, Emma spotted Marci standing nearby with Amber. As she walked over to join them, Marci hugged Emma and said, “I’m proud of you, honey.”

“Thanks, Marci.” Glancing back at Grace, Emma said, “I just couldn’t shake the feeling that she needed my help.”

Amber stepped away briefly and returned with two large bags. Handing them to Emma, she said, “ “Everything’s on the house, Emma; my boss said it’s the least she could do after what you did.”

Peaking inside one of the bags; Emma saw an assortment of bras, panties, and several swimsuits. Looking back at Amber, Emma said, “Thanks, Amber.”

Amber stayed around for a few more minutes until she had to return to work; leaving Marci and Emma standing just outside the store. Emma waved at Grace as she walked past with Officer Sullivan, which prompted Grace to come over and give her a hug. “Thanks again for everything.”

“There’s no need to thank me; I did what needed to be done.” With a pause, Emma said, “What’s going to happen now?”

“Officer Sullivan said they’ll contact my parents once we get to the station.” With a weak smile, Grace said, “If you give me your number, I’ll text you afterwards.”

Emma realized that she was in a bind; the only phone number she had was Dom’s. Realizing that was her only choice, she relented and gave that to Grace. “With everything going on, I forgot to introduce myself.” Extending her hand, Emma said, “My name’s Emma.”

“It’s nice to meet you, Emma.” With a chuckle, Grace said, “Maybe we can hang out sometime? My folks and I live in West Palm Beach.”

Emma didn’t see a problem with that; Grace seemed like a nice girl and it certainly wouldn’t hurt to have some friends. “I’d like that.”
1111111111121111111.title: Emma Makes A Friend

11111111111211111111.content:
Marci felt that she needed to sit and relax after what happened at Victoria’s Secret, so she decided to treat Emma to lunch at the Food Court. As they came around the corner, Marci handed Emma $15 and said, “I’m going to buy a burger and fries; you can buy whatever."

Once Marci walked off, Emma looked around at the options available to her. Normally in situations like this, Dominic would buy something stomach-churning for lunch; Emma wasn’t going to do anything like that. After a moment, she settled on a nearby delicatessen and went to get in line.

While looking over the menu Emma realized she’d made the right choice when an attractive guy, probably a few years older, appeared behind the register. She was so fixated on him that she wasn’t paying attention to what was happening around her – until she felt a tap on her shoulder. Turning around, she saw a flustered looking woman in a business suit gesturing for her to move forward.

As she approached the counter, the guy smiled and said, “Do you see anything you like?”

Leaning against the counter, accentuating her chest ever so slightly, Emma said, “I was about to ask you the same thing.”

If the guy was caught off guard by Emma’s openness, he didn’t show it. What happened next was the two of them started to flirt back and forth with each other; much to the annoyance of the people waiting in line behind Emma. Eventually the sound of angry customers attracted the attention of the manager, who came up from to see what was happening. “Daren, I’m not paying you to flirt with every girl who comes up to the counter.”
Jumping to attention, Daren said, “Sorry sir.”

The looks Emma was getting from the manager and other customers was enough to keep her silent. After quickly ordering a salad and a diet soda, Emma hurriedly went to join Marci at a nearby table. Before she’d even sat down, Marci was staring at Emma, “Care to explain what that as all about?”

Already embarrassed by the fact that she’d been yelled at, without even looking at Marci, Emma said, “I-I don’t know what you’re talking about.”

“Oh please, I saw the whole thing.” Leaning closer, Marci said, “You were definitely flirting with that guy.”

By this point Emma knew there was no way she’d be getting out of this. “Okay fine; I admit that I was flirting with him.” Casually looking back towards Daren, Emma said, “I thought he was cute.”

After seeing her best friend get turned into a teenage girl, Marci thought nothing would surprise her – until now. “Did you seriously just say you think he was cute?” Looking Emma square in the eyes, Marci said, “Who are you and what have you done with Dominic?”

“Let’s just say Dominic’s taking a little vacation.” Looking up from her salad, without even skipping a beat, Emma said, “My name’s Emma.”

Marci laughed, until she noticed that Emma wasn't laughing at all. "You're serious, aren't you?"

“I’m super serious; Dominic’s gone and I’m in control.” Looking across the table, a serious look in her eyes, Emma said, “Now I’m not sure how long I’m going to be around; so I’d prefer not to spend it thinking about that loser.”

Emma spent the next 10 minutes answering all of Marci’s questions; from how she came to be into existence to how she took full control. Once Emma was finished, Marci said, “Tell me something; is Dominic still in there?”

“I’ll be honest, I have no idea.” Tapping her fork against the salad bowl, Emma said, “I have all his memories; but as for his actual consciousness, I have no idea where that is. Right now, I’m just operating under the assumption that my consciousness is suppressing his.”

While Marci was concerned about her friend, she found herself unable to stop thinking about everything she’d just learned. Thinking back on everything that’d happened since the hospital, Marci said, “Everything all makes sense now; your our behavior in the car; that bra; and now you flirting with that boy.”

“Duh, of course that was me.” Sipping her soda, Emma said, “Did you really think that doofus would do any of that?”

“Hey!” letting her emotions come out briefly, Marci said, “That’s my best friend you’re talking about.”

“Whatev.” Sighing Emma said, “You wouldn’t be so quick to defend him if he you what he really thought of you.”

Having been a teenage girl herself, Marci knew at once that Emma was goading her. “Okay, I’ll bite.” Composing herself, Marci said, “What does he really think about me?”

“Don’t say I didn’t warn you; but he really hates your glasses.” Taking a sip of her drink, Emma continued, “He also doesn’t think it’s a big loss that you’re not into guys.”

Marci couldn’t believe that Dominic really thought that way about her. Looking at Emma, she said, “How do I know you’re not just saying that to get a rise out of me?”

“Please; I have all his memories.” Looking at Marci, Emma continued, “Now personally I couldn’t care less about you; but you’re
the one with the credit card, so...”

Retrieving her cellphone from her purse, Marci looked for Harold’s number. “If you think we’re going to keep shopping, then you’re sorely mistaken missy.” Looking up from her phone, Marci said, “Mr. Northam told me to call him if anything strange happened; I’m pretty sure this qualifies.”

Taking Marci’s phone and dropping it in her soda, a smug look on her face, Emma said, “Here’s the deal; I still need a new wardrobe, so we’re going to keep shopping.” Leaning back, her arms crossed, Emma said, “If you so much as look at me the wrong way, I’ll make your life a living hell.”
11111111111211111111.title: Marci Learns the Truth

111111111112111111111.content:
Rather than risk making a scene in the Food Court, Marci decided her best course of action was to continue with the shopping. “Okay fine, we’ll keep shopping.” Fishing her now ruined phone out of the cup, Marci said, “But mark my words, I’ll be watching you.”

Getting up from the table, with a sarcastic attitude, Emma said, “Oh I’m so scared.”

As Marci got up to follow Emma, she thought to herself – was I this bad as a teenager?

********************


20 minutes later, after going to T-Mobile to buy a new phone, Marci and Emma walked into the Abercrombie and Fitch store. The first thing Emma noticed was three familiar faces in the distance: the girls who’d been watching her earlier. Rather than focus on them, Emma quickly made a bee line for the girl’s section.

Marci watched from the sidelines as Emma went through the rows grabbing everything that she could get her hands on; from skinny jeans and skirts to halter tops and shorts. Some of them were reminiscent of outfits Marci would’ve worn at that age, while others were far too revealing for her taste.

Grabbing a halter top from the pile building in the cart, Marci held it up to Emma and said, “Are you sure you’d be comfortable wearing this? It looks like it would barely cover your chest.”

“God, that’s the whole point.” Forcibly grabbing the halter top back, Emma said, “There’s nothing wrong with showing a little skin.”

“Need I remind you that you’re only 15 years old?” rummaging through the pile, Marci said, “Half the clothes you have in here
aren’t even age appropriate.”

“Let me guess: when the teacher wanted to talk about the great American flatlands, every boy in the room pointed at you.” Moving behind the cart, Emma started pushing it towards the dressing room, “I’m going to start trying these on; why don’t you, you know, do something?”

Marci simply waved Emma off as the latter entered the dressing area. Once she was certain the coast was clear, Marci retrieved her phone and dialed Harold’s cellphone. He answered after a few seconds, “Marci? How’s everything going at the mall?”

“Not well, sir.” Looking at the dressing area, Marci said, “We’ve got a problem.”
111111111112111111111.title: The Shopping Continues

1111111111121111111111.content:
Emma spent almost 20 minutes trying on every one of the 3 dozen outfits that she’d picked out; totally unaware of the conversation Marci was having with Harold only 20 feet away. Emma liked most of the outfits but had to begrudgingly admit that Marci was right about a few of them being inappropriate for her age.

Emma eventually settled on the outfits she was going to keep; including one to wear out of the store that consisted of skinny jeans plus a top that both showed her midriff and some cleavage. After placing the discarded items in a bin, Emma pushed the cart outside to find Marci talking on her phone.

Getting suspicious, Emma walked up to her and said, “You weren’t calling Harold, were you?”

“No, I wasn’t calling Harold.” Putting her phone away, Marci said, “That was my wife; our gynecologist had to reschedule our next ultrasound.”

Emma stared at Marci for a moment; on the fence as to whether she believed her or not. Choosing to drop the matter, Emma did a spin and said, “What do you think of my outfit?”

Marci watched as Emma spun around again, taking in her outfit from every angle. It reminded her of some of the outfits she’d worn during her rebellious stage during her Junior year. But having matured since then, Marci wasn’t exactly a fan of it. “It’s a little revealing for my tastes; but as long as you like it.” Following Emma, Marci said, “Just be prepared for all the attention you’ll get; from guys and girls.”

Emma spun around to look at Marci, “I better not catch you ogling me; I already got one pervert arrested today.”

Marci understood at once what Emma was implying, “You don’t have to worry about that; I’m not attracted to bitches.”

Choosing to ignore that jab at her expense, Emma rounded a corner and accidently ran into the girl’s from earlier – knocking one of them to the ground. After getting back on her feet, the blonde spun around and glared at Emma. “Watch where you’re going, loser!”

Marci rounded the corner in time to see Emma get right in the girl’s face; for a moment Marci feared they would start fighting. “Who do you think you’re calling a loser?”

“Do you see anyone else around?” Waving her arm in a circle, the blonde said, “Or are you as blind as you are stupid?”

From her vantage point Marci got a good look at Emma’s face. Marci imagined that if the blonde had punched her in the gut instead of insulting her, Emma still wouldn’t have looked as shocked as she was. Seeing their altercation was attracting the attention of the staff, Marci stepped between the two and said, “Okay that’s enough; the last thing anyone wants is a fight.”

“Oh please, I’d wipe the floor with her.” Looking Emma up and down, the blonde said, “She’s nothing but a poser; a goody-goody trying to get some attention by acting out.”

Marci stole a quick glance at Emma and realized that, to her surprise, the blonde may have been right. Gone was the bratty attitude Emma had been giving off since lunch; replaced with the look of a frightened girl who was out of her league. Before Marci could move to check on her, one of the blonde’s friends got a good look at Emma. “Madi, this is the girl from earlier; the one who got the perverted old man arrested.”

Madi’s demeanor changed in an instant as she realized her friend was right. “I think you’re right, Sadie.” Turning back to Emma, Madi said, “It’s about time that guy got caught; a couple months ago I found him stealing a glance while I was trying on a bikini.”
Emma was clearly taken aback by Madi’s abrupt change in attitude, “I couldn’t shake the feeling that his granddaughter was in
danger; I wasn’t going to risk him taking advantage of her.”

Marci stepped back as all four girls started chatting with each other; amused by the idea that Emma used to be her best friend. Dominic would tell her stories about his misadventures with girls in High School, while Emma didn’t seem to have any problem relating to these girls.

Things got complicated for a moment after Emma mentioned seeing the brunette, Sadie, around the pool a few times. “Are you sure?” looking at Emma, Sadie said, “I think I’d remember seeing you around the building.”

“I don’t live there full time, I just occasionally spend the weekend with my sister and her fiancé.” With a smile, Emma said, “I’m not surprised you don’t recognize me; I just recently had a growth spurt.”

The girls talked for a few more minutes until the third girl, a red head named Amber, said, “We should be going guys, we don’t want to miss our mani/pedi appointment.”

“Oh right, we don’t want to miss that.” Turning back to Emma, Sadie said, “We’re having a slumber party at my place tonight; if you’re not doing anything, feel free to come by.”

To Marci’s surprise, Emma looked to her as if asking permission. “Sure, I don’t see why not.”

After getting the details from Sadie, Emma and Marci walked off to pay for their purchases. “Thanks for that.” Without looking at Marci, Emma said, “Maybe you’re not such a bitch after all.”

“Maybe you’re not as bad as I thought either.” Placing an affectionate hand on Emma’s shoulder, Marci said, “Guess all you needed was a taste of your own medicine.”

“I guess.” Pausing, Emma said, “Now we just have to get me some shoes to go with all these clothes.”

*******************************


Marci and Emma took an Uber back to Dominic and Rebecca’s condo; they each took a few of the bags and walked inside. The two of them had talked during the car ride, with them both coming to a mutual understanding of each other. As Marci fumbled through her purse for Dominic’s keys, she turned to Emma and said, “I have to say, even though you were a complete jerk most of the time; it was nice having a little sister for the day.”

As Marci unlocked the door, Emma said, “I suppose I could have done worse in the fake sister department.”

Walking in behind Marci, Emma stopped in her tracks when she rounded the corner into the family room and saw Harold sitting on the couch. Dropping the bags to the ground, she looked at Harold as he said, “Hello. Emma, is it?”
