11111111111211111111111.content:
Emma spun around and focused all her anger on Marci, “You bitch, I told you not to call Harold.”

“Oh please, like you’re the first bully I’ve ever dealt with.” Getting right in Emma’s face, Marci said, “Need I remind you; I was a lesbian growing up in rural Alabama.”

Emma’s anger faded for a moment as she realized just what Marci was referring to. Looking at her, Emma said, “What did you think calling him would accomplish?” gesturing towards Harold, Emma said, “The man’s nothing but a suit; like he has any idea where I came from.”

Marci and Emma were so focused on each other that neither saw Harold briefly turn pale. Composing himself, Harold walked over and separated the two girls. “Listen here Emma; Marci called me because she’s concerned about Dominic, a concern that I share as well.”

“Are you being serious right now?” raising an eyebrow, Emma said, “I’ve got all of Dominic’s memories; I know just how little you care about him.”

Marci knew both from experience, and stories from Dominic, that Harold had a less than stellar opinion of his future son-in-law. So, you could imagine her surprise when Marci saw that Emma’s remark had hurt Harold. Sitting down in a nearby chair, Harold composed himself for a moment before saying, “Of course I care about Dominic; I’m only tough on him because I want to mold him into a man worthy of my daughter.”

Scoffing, Emma said, “Please, do you really expect me to believe that?” gesturing towards Marci, she continued, “If you do, then you’re as dumb as she is.”

Everyone present in the room, even Harold, was surprised by what happened next. Getting to his feet Harold loomed over Emma and, with his most authoritative voice, yelled, “Listen here, young lady; I’ve about had it with your attitude.” Glaring at Emma, he continued yelling, “You may have been able to pull the wool over Marci’s eyes; but that doesn’t make her dumb.”

For the second time in less than an hour, Marci watched as Emma’s mean girl demeanor was replaced with fear. A smirk formed on her face as she watched Emma cower under Harold’s gaze. Looking at Harold, trying to act tough, Emma said, “You can’t talk to me like that, you’re not my father.”

“That may be true; but I’m the closest thing to a father you have right now.” Trying to calm down. Harold said, “Now I want you to apologize to Marci, right now.”

Emma’s stubborn nature meant that she wanted to resist, but the look she was getting from Harold told her that would be unwise. Begrudgingly, she walked over to Marci and said, “I’m sorry for calling you a bitch and saying you’re dumb.”

“I accept your apology, Emma.” With a sigh, Marci said, “If you feel like making it up to me, perhaps you can let us talk to Dominic?”

For a moment Emma looked as though she was going to lash out again; until she sighed and said, “I don’t really know how I took control in the first place; but I suppose it’s worth a shot.”

Harold and Marci watched as Emma sat down on the couch and closed her eyes. After a moment where nothing happened, Marci saw Emma’s head flop to one side. Before she could go check on her, Marci saw Emma’s eyes slowly start to open. Getting on one knee, Marci looked at her and said, “Dominic, is that you?”

“Yeah it’s me; can someone tell me what’s going on?”

Harold and Marci, working under the assumption that Dominic was experiencing short term memory problems, explained everything that happened since the hospital. Once that was finished, Marci said, “She’s calling herself Emma; and let me tell you, she’s been a handful.”

Dominic slowly stood up and walked towards the kitchen; only stopping when he walked by a mirror by the bathroom door. As he turned to look at the mirror, Dominic’s jaw dropped when he saw his reflection and the outfit Emma had been wearing. Covering his mouth to keep from screaming, Dominic said, “What the hell am I wearing?”
11111111111211111111111.title: Confronting Emma

111111111112111111111111.content:
Taking the current situation into account, Marci was surprised by how calm Dominic was. To be fair, Dominic was freaking out; but he just wasn’t balled up in the corner or running around the room screaming. He was looking over his body from every angle; occasionally using his hands but otherwise there wasn’t much physical contact.

After a few minutes of this, he went around the corner and returned with a blanket wrapped around his body. Looking at Marci, I said, “How could you let me, I mean her, pick this outfit?” his body language somewhat on the feminine side, Dominic said, “It’s too tight in places where it shouldn’t be, and shows way to much skin for a 15 year old.”

Guiding Dominic to the couch, Marci said, “I know it’s not an appropriate outfit; she told me she chose it to attract guys.”

As he took a seat on the couch next to Marci, Dominic’s eyes went wide as he remembered an incident at the mall. “Oh God, she was really into that guy Daren from the restaurant.” Blushing, Dominic turned to Marci and said, “I know you were watching from a distance; but you when they were up at the counter, Emma was definitely pulling out all the stops.”

Having stepped into the kitchen for a drink, Harold returned and saw Marci trying her best to comfort a visibly scared 15-year-old girl. Walking over to them, he said, “Dominic, I haven’t the foggiest idea how this happened; but I will find a way to undo this.”

Harold decided to chalk what happened net up to the stressful situation everyone was in as Dominic quickly got up from the couch and ran over to hug Harold. Harold was taken aback by the uncharacteristic display of affection from Dominic; it was as if he feared Harold would disappear. As Harold returned the hug, Dominic looked up at him with tears in his eyes, “Thank you, Harold.”

Looking at Dominic, with a tone a father would use to soothe a frightened child, Harold said, “You’re welcome, Dominic.”

Breaking the hug, Dominic barely made it two steps before collapsing to the floor. Thinking something had happened, Marci and Harold ran to his aid; only for his body to sit and groan as a hand massaged his scalp, “I probably should’ve let him get to the couch before retaking control.”

Exchanging a brief look with Harold, Marci said, “Emma? Is that you?”

“Yeah, it’s me.” Getting up from the floor, Emma said, “I hope you enjoyed that little chat; because I don’t think it’ll be happening again.”

Harold followed behind as Marci helped Emma to the couch, “What do you mean by that, Emma?”

“I mean doing that took a lot out of me.” Sitting on the couch, Emma said, “I’m the dominant personality at the moment, so letting Dominic’s personality take over was mentally taxing.”

Sitting next to Emma, affectionately rubbing her shoulder, Marci turned to Harold, “What are the chances this isn’t permanent? That Dominic and Emma will switch back and forth.”

Harold was hesitant to answer, knowing that any investigation into what happened would eventually lead to his role being uncovered. “Until today I hadn’t the foggiest idea something like this was even possible; so, I can’t really venture a guess.” Sighing, Harold said, “In the meantime, let’s operate under the assumption that this is permanent.”

Moving a few stray strands of hair from her face, Emma looked at Harold, “What exactly does that mean for me?” sitting back on the couch, her attitude far less confrontational than earlier, she continued, “Even you could let a 15 year old work in your company, I know absolutely nothing about computers.”

Hearing that, Harold said, “That’s interesting; are you saying you have none of Dominic’s knowledge?”

“I know all about Dominic’s personal life, as well as everything he knew when he was my age.” Looking at Harold, with a shrug, Olivia said, “Everything beyond that is a fog.”

Harold wanted to investigate that further; but with no science background, he had no clue where to begin. “We’ll discuss what we’ll do about that tomorrow.” Clapping his hands together, Harold said, “In the meantime, I think it would be prudent for you not to venture outside this condo.”

Recalling her plans to attend Sadie’s slumber party, Emma winced and said, “Yeah about that; I kind of made plans to attend a slumber party tonight.”

With a raised eyebrow, Harold turned to Marci who said, “We ran into one of Dominic and Rebecca’s neighbors; she and her friends are having a slumber party tonight and invited Emma.”

Gently guiding Marci into the kitchen, out of view of Emma, Harold said, “Do you really think that’s a smart idea, Marci?”

“I don’t see what the big deal is, sir.” Glancing around the corner at Emma, Marci said, “I haven’t got a clue where she came from; but Emma’s got the mind and body of a 15-year-old girl. Who are we to stop her from making friends with girls her age?”

“I’m not against that per se, but I’m not sure either of you has thought this through.” Sighing, Harold said, “What if Emma turns back into Dominic; you’ll have a 26-year-old man in an awkward situation with three teenage girls.”

“We don’t even know if this is reversible, sir; it wouldn’t be wise to speculate on that.”

Just then Emma walked into the kitchen and retrieved a soda from the fridge. Opening it and taking a sip, Emma said, “What are you guys talking about?”

“Harold doesn’t think it’s smart for you to attend Sadie’s sleepover; I was trying to convince him otherwise.”

Turning to Harold, giving him the same look his daughters used to give him, Emma said, “Come on Harold; I need to hang out with people my own age.”

Harold had never been able to resist that look before; and he certainly wasn’t able to now. “Okay fine, you can go to the slumber party.”
111111111112111111111111.title: Dominic's Back

111112.content:
Marci was a nervous wreck as she sat on a bench in the adjacent locker room; all she knew was that Dominic had been in trouble, and the silence coming from the shower wasn’t doing anything to calm her down. Please God, she thought, let Dominic be alright.

Suddenly, as if responding to Marci’s prayer, a voice from inside the shower asked, “Would you guys mind turning around, please?”

The look on Marci’s face was a mixture of surprise and relief; but mostly surprise, due to the voice unmistakably belonging to a woman. Driven by curiosity, Marci walked over and peered inside the shower – only to find a mature woman standing inside the shower, drenched from head to toe. While she struggled to hold up a pair of boxers with one hand, and cover her ample chest with the other, the woman looked at Marci and said, “I don’t suppose you can tell me what’s going on here?”

“I was just about to ask you the same thing.” Entering the shower, stepping over a puddle, Marci said, “Let’s with the basics; like who are you, and what have you done with Dominic?"

“I know this is going to sound crazy; but I am Dominic, somehow I’ve been turned into a woman.”
111112.title: Dominic, the grown woman

choices: Heading to the Hospital (Marci and Dominic)
1111121.content:
Marci was understandably skeptical about the woman before her being her best friend; so, she decided to ask some questions only Dominic would know the answer to. A few minutes later, after a few tough questions, Marci was convinced that the woman was telling her the truth.

While the guards were conversing with their boss about what to do next, Marci led Dominic back into the locker room. Marci retrieved Dominic’s clothes from the bench; handing them to him as she said, “I know these won’t necessarily fit you anymore, but it’s the best we’ve got.”

“Thanks.” Taking the close towards one of the bathroom stalls, Dominic turned back and said, “I just wish I had a bra right now; because these are too large to go unsupported.”

Marci thought it was weird that Dominic’s first thought was about bras but didn’t say anything about it. Instead, as Dominic entered the bathroom stall, she said, “Let’s figure out what happened to you; then, if necessary, we can go to the mall and buy you some clothes.”

Poking his head out the door, Dominic smiled and said, “Thanks, Marci.”
1111121.title: Getting Dressed

11111212.content:
Harold wasn’t sure how long it would take for the XP-3 to start working on Dominic; but after finishing up a morning conference call, he decided it was time to go check on him. Taking the elevator down to the IT Department, he found the door locked and the lights off. A quick peak through the window showed there was no one inside.

Thinking that was a little strange, Harold crossed the hall to another office and spotted a middle-aged woman sitting behind a desk. “Excuse me,” knocking on the door, he said, “Do you know why there’s no one in the IT office?”

The woman looked up from her computer and, upon seeing the head of the company standing in front of her, she said, “No sir, I’m afraid I don’t.”

Without saying another word, Harold returned to the elevator. Suddenly concerned, he took the elevator down to the basement to the Security Department. As he made his way through the winding hallway, he couldn’t shake the feeling that something was wrong. Arriving outside the office, he was about to go inside when a security officer stepped out and nearly collided with him. “Sorry sir, I didn’t see you there.”

“That’s quite alright, son.” Sighing, Harold said, “I’m looking for two employees: Dominic Harrison and Marci Collins. Do you know where they are?”

Harold became concerned when the guard’s face turned pale; “Sir, uh, they’re on the way to the hospital.” Pausing, he said,
“There was an accident and Mr. Harrison was...well, I don’t know how to explain it.”

Harold felt a lump in his throat; fearing that he’d just killed his daughter’s fiancé. “I don’t have all day, son; just tell me what happened to Mr. Harrison?”

The guard paused for a few moments as he tried to figure the best way to answer. “That’s just it, sir; he’s more of a Ms. Harrison now, if you catch my drift.”

Suddenly it was Harold’s turn to go pale; looking at the guard, he said, “What are you saying?”

The guard was silent once again as he prepared himself for what was to come. “Something happened in that lab and, well, Mr. Harrison is now a woman.”

With that, Harold spun around and ran back down the hallway to the elevator.
11111212.title: Learning of the Incident

111112121.content:
Upon arriving at the hospital, Harold spent 15 minutes trying to figure out where Dominic and Marci were. No one at the front desk seemed to have a clue, so he eventually decided to get Marci’s number from HR and call her. That chain of events led him to the Radiology wing, where he saw Marci waiting outside a closed door.

Approaching Marci, a look of genuine concern on his face, Harold said, “What’s going on, is Dominic alright?”

“I won’t even attempt to answer that question, sir; no one here has ever seen anything like this.” Getting to her feet, Marci said, “They must’ve taken 6 vials of blood to run whatever tests they could think of.”

“I should probably go check on him, where is he?”

Raising a hand towards the closed door, Marci said, “He’s been in there for about 20 minutes now; the doctor is...sir, wait!”

Seeing what Harold was about to do, Marci tried to stop him but it was too late; Harold had opened the door and walked in on a mature-looking woman getting a mammogram.
111112121.title: At the Hospital

choices: Making a Plan (Dominic, Marci and Harold's POV)
1111121211.content:
Before he could remedy the situation, Harold found himself face to face with an irate woman in a hospital gown. Slapping him in the face, she said, “Dammit Harold; don’t you know better than to knock before coming into a room?”

Bringing a hand to his tender cheek, Harold looked at Dominic and said, “I’m sorry Dominic, I-I should have knocked.”

As Marci walked into the room behind Harold, Dominic said, “Being an older woman is already messed up; I don’t need my boss barging in while I’m undergoing a private procedure.”

“I’m sorry, Dominic.” With Marci appearing next to him, Harold said, “I’ll wait outside until you’re finished.”

******************************


The next 15 minutes weren’t great for Harold, as Marci spent the entire time lecturing him about what he did. “Mammograms are a sensitive topic even for someone born female.” Looking at Harold, she said, “Now try to imagine what it’s like for Dominic; especially after enduring a pelvic exam.”

“How many times do I have to apologize?” getting annoyed, Harold said, “I got worried when I heard what happened; I guess I was too wound up to think about what I was doing.”

Much to Harold’s relief, the door opened a few minutes later and a morose-looking Dominic stepped out of the room with the doctor. As Harold and Marci approached him, Dominic said, “You’ll both be happy to know that I’m now a perfectly healthy 37-year-old woman.” Getting into a wheelchair, Dominic said, “The doctor said until they figure out what caused this, the chances of my being male again are pretty slim.”

Harold tried to hide his anxiety as he followed the others; wondering if he should come clean about what he did. But the more he thought about it, the more he realized that he shouldn’t do that – at least for the time being. Catching up to them, Harold focused on the doctor and said, “Do you have any possibilities as to what may have caused this?”

“Not in the slightest; I didn’t even know something like this was possible until this morning.” Pushing Dominic around a corner, the doctor said, “All I can suggest for now is that Mr. Harrison’s loved ones do what they can to help him during this transition.”

Casting a quick glance at Harold, Dominic said, “If you have any ideas on how to explain this to Rebecca, I’m all ears.”
1111121211.title: Continue

11111212111.content:
While Marci was helping Dominic use the bathroom, Harold stepped out in the hall to make a phone call. The phone rang twice before his secretary Meredith answered the phone, “Mr. Northam’s office.”

“Meredith, it’s me.” Putting his phone on speaker, Harold said, “I’m sending you some measurements; I need you to buy a woman’s outfit in that size, shoes included.”

Hearing her cellphone beep, Meredith looked down and saw a list of measurements appear on her screen. Looking at them for a moment, she started to wonder why Mr. Northam wanted her to suddenly buy a woman’s outfit. “Sir, why do you need me to buy a woman’s outfit?”

“There’s no time to answer that; just please do it.” Sighing, Harold said, “Just buy something that you’d be comfortable wearing; and bring it to the hospital as soon as possible.”

After ending the call, Harold walked back into the room just as Marci stepped out of the bathroom with Dominic. Rather than head towards the bed, Dominic went and took a seat in a nearby chair. Harold watched as Dominic quickly crossed his legs in a feminine manner; perplexing him but not enough to ask about it.

As Dominic sat in the chair, he turned to face Marci, “I really appreciate all your help, Marci; I’m sure I wouldn’t be doing nearly as well without your help.” With a smile, he said, “This wasn’t how I expected my day to go; and I can certainly imagine that it’s the same for you.”

“Well it’s not every day that your best friend gets himself turned into a middle-aged woman; so, I like to think I’m handling it pretty well.” Placing an affectionate hand on Dominic’s left shoulder, Marci said, “I’m sure you’d do the same for me if it had happened to
me.”

The three of them talked for a few minutes about whatever was on their minds. There were times where Harold caught Dominic doing or saying something peculiar; like calling Marci ‘honey’ or staring at him for a few moments. The way Dominic was looking at him, it was almost as if Dominic was checking Harold out.

Rather than bring up what would probably lead to a heated argument, Harold said, “I was on the phone with Meredith while you two were in the bathroom; I didn’t go into a lot of detail but she’s going to the mall to purchase an outfit four you.” Looking at Dominic, with genuine concern, Harold said, “When you’re ready, I’m sure she’ll be willing to help you adjust to being middle-aged.”

“I’d really appreciate it if you guys would stop calling me middle-aged.” With an annoyed sighed, Dominic said, “I’m only 36 years old according to the doctor; last time I checked that wasn’t exactly middle-aged.”

That remark made Harold chuckle ever so briefly; as he said, “Just like a woman to be sensitive about her age.”

Harold instantly came to regret that remark as Dominic quickly got to his feet and got right in his face. “Don’t make me slap you again, Harold.” Trying to regain composure, Dominic said, “If being 36 makes me middle-aged; then you’re positively ancient by comparison.”

Marci watched from the corner as Dominic and Harold squared off; on one side an angry woman, on the other a nervous looking man. She was concerned things would come to blows until they were saved by the sound of Dominic’s phone ringing. As she dug it out of Dominic’s discarded pants, her relief became short-lived when she saw that Rebecca was calling. “Uh oh.”
11111212111.title: In The Hospital Room

111112121111.content:
An unexpected thunderstorm had knock out power to the convention center where Rebecca was supposed to have her conference. Her plans upended for the day, she returned to the hotel to relax.

After changing into her bathing suit, and grabbing a book, Rebecca went to the indoor pool on the hotel’s top floor. Deciding to hold off on taking a swim for a while, she sat down in a lounge chair. Having been so busy with conference prep all day, she hadn’t had an opportunity to think about her fight with Dominic the night before.

Reaching for her cell phone, she said, “I should probably call him; and see if he’s willing to talk.”

Dialing Dominic’s number, she was surprised to see her father’s face appear on screen, “Daddy? Why are you answering Dominic’s phone?”

Rebecca watched as Harold looked at someone offscreen; she could almost pick up someone else’s voice. Turning back to the screen, Harold said, “Rebecca, sweetie; there’s something you should know about Dominic.”

Before Rebecca could ask what that meant, the screen turned to show the face of an older woman. With a sudden burst of anger, Rebecca said, “That bastard; we have one fight, and he goes off to find some cougar to screw around with?”

The look on the woman’s face was one of pure anger; Rebecca could see that she was about to say something until Harold turned the phone back towards him, “Dominic’s not having an affair, sweetie.” Taking a deep breath, he continued, “We’re not sure how it happened; but this woman is Dominic.”
111112121111.title: Up in New York

1111121211111.content:
Dominic could hardly blame Rebecca for what she did next; he would’ve done the same thing in her position. While Dominic and the others watched, Rebecca burst out laughing. This continued for a few moments until she stopped to get her breath, “I’m sorry Daddy, but that’s got to be your worst joke attempt ever.” Looking closer at the screen, she said, “Granted that woman does look a little like Dominic; there’s no way that’s actually him.”

Harold and Marci both stared at Dominic, wondering how he was going to react. “Your dad’s telling the truth, Becca; as weird as it sounds, I am your fiancé.”

Rebecca laughed for a moment before her face turned serious, “Look ma’am, I’m not sure how you got roped into this; but there’s no way an older woman such as yourself could possibly be my fiancé.”

Dominic’s face flashed red with anger, “I’m only 36 years old; last time I checked that was hardly considered old.” Calming himself, Dominic continued, “Apart from taking a DNA test, what must I do in order to convince you that I’m telling the truth?”

Rebecca was starting to get some weird looks from the other pool goers, so she got up and walked out into the hall. Once she was outside, she said, “I’ll ask you some questions that only Dominic would know the answer to.” Leaning against the wall, she said, “First question; where did me first meet?”

“That’s easy; at a frat mixer on campus, you were in the corner making out with your roommate.” Smiling, Dominic said, “As I recall, you seemed rather into it.”

While Harold was less than thrilled to hear about his daughter’s college escapades, Marci couldn’t help but smile at the thought of Rebecca having a little girl-on-girl action. Realizing that her father was still present, Rebecca decided to tone it down for the next few questions.

Eventually, after asking eight different questions, Rebecca came to the realization that Dominic had been telling the truth. “Dom, you’re actually a woman? How is that even possible?”

“I haven’t the foggiest idea how it’s possible; one minute I’m helping Marci with an assignment, the next I’m doubling over in pain.” Sighing, Dominic said, “I was brought to the hospital for some tests; probably the most memorable part was when your dad walked in on me during a mammogram.”

Seeing her father standing behind Dominic, Rebecca said, “Seriously Dad?”

“Believe me, sweetie; I think that’s something both Dominic and I would very much like to forget."

Rebecca must’ve been doing a search while she was talking, “The earliest flight back to Miami leaves tomorrow morning; it’s got like 3 layovers, but I should be back home by early evening.” Pausing, she said, “In the meantime, let me know if anything else comes up.”

The call ended soon after that; with Dominic looking at the others, “I think that went pretty well, don’t you think?”

“If you say so,” looking at Dominic, Marci said, “I don’t like how she automatically assumed you were having an affair.”

Walking over a with glass of water for Dominic, Harold said, “At least she believes you; now all we have to do is find a way to reverse this.”

Suddenly a knock on the door grabbed everyone’s attention, as Meredith’s voice was heard outside, “Mr. Northam, I’ve got the clothes you requested.”
1111121211111.title: Reactions & Explanations

11111212111111.content:
While Harold brought Marci to the cafeteria, Dominic stood in front of the bed looking at the outfit Meredith had bought for him. He didn’t have any problems with Meredith; but he always thought her sense of fashion was too professional – something that was reinforced by the woman’s business suit lying on the bed in front of him.

Dominic started pacing around the room; crossing his arms across his chest only to stop due to the unfamiliar feeling of his breasts. “There’s no way I can do this.” Grasping one arm with the other, Dominic looked at the ceiling and said, “I haven’t got the faintest clue about how to be a woman.”

*You’re telling me, sweetie.*

Dominic looked around, thinking perhaps someone had entered the room without him knowing. When he realized he was alone,
he said, “Who said that?”

*I think it’s time we had a talk, Dominic.*

Before Dominic even had a chance to react, the room started to spin as he started to lose consciousness. When he woke up again, he found himself lying on the floor of the hospital room. He breathed a sigh of relief, as he got to his feet, when he saw his old male reflection looking back at him in the mirror, “Thank god that nightmare’s over.”

Suddenly a familiar voice behind him said, “I wouldn’t celebrate just yet, Dominic; I don’t think you’re going to like where things go from here.”

Spinning around, Dominic found himself face to face with a familiar woman - the same one he’d seen in the mirror for the last couple of hours. The only difference was this time she was wearing an elegant dress that accentuated her figure and showed off some cleavage. Cautiously approaching the woman, he said, “Who are you? What’s going on here?”

“You can call me Marilyn; an appropriate name for an elegant woman such as myself.” getting to her feet, the woman said, “As for what’s happening here; it’s become clear that you’re in no position to take advantage of this new body you’ve been given. So, I’ll be taking control from here on out.”

“Wait, what do you mean you’re taking control?” slowly backing away, Dominic said, “This is my body, and I’m not letting you or anyone else take control of it.”

“Oh please; you said it yourself you have no clue how to be a grown woman.” Looking at Dominic, Marilyn said, “On the other hand; I am a grown woman and am therefore in a much better position then you are.”

“Please, there’s got to be an alternative to this.” Getting nervous, Dominic said, “Why can’t you just teach me how to be a woman?”

Marilyn laughed as she took a seat on the bed, “That would take too much time; my way will be easier for the both of us.”

“How do you think Rebecca is going to react when she figures out the truth?” with a determined look on his face, Dominic said,
“She’s not going to take too kindly to you once she finds out what she’s done.”

“You needn’t worry about your adorable fiancé, Dominic; I’ve got half a mind to put her in her place.” Seeing the perplexed reaction from Dominic, Marilyn said, “You can’t seriously tell me you find her bossy attitude appealing, do you?”

Dominic reluctantly admitted that Marilyn was right; as much as he loved Rebecca, there were times where she was overly bossy and controlling. “She just gets that from Harold; her sister’s like that as well.”

“Oh please, Grace is a saint compared to Rebecca.” Getting back to her feet, Marilyn said, “But it’s funny that you mentioned Harold; because I happen to find that an attractive quality in a man.”

Dominic resisted the urge to gag, “Are you seriously saying you find Harold attractive?”

“Oh, very much so.” Looking at Dominic, she said, “You can’t deny that you found him attractive as well; I saw the way you were looking at him as he left with Marci.”

Dominic blushed, “You’re crazy; there’s no way I’m attracted to Harold.”

“There’s nothing to be ashamed of, sweetie; it’s okay for women to find men attractive.”

“But I’m not a woman.”

Coming up behind Dominic, Marilyn spun him around and said, “Have you looked in the mirror lately?”

Dominic looked at the mirror and gasped; his reflection was now identical to Marilyn’s in every way. Bringing a feminine hand up to his equally feminine face, Dominic said, “H-How is this happening?”

Resting her hands against Dominic’s waist, causing him to jump a bit, Marilyn said, “I’d think it would be obvious, sweetie; you’re becoming a woman.”

Stepping back from both Marilyn and the mirror, stunned to see his outfit now matched hers as well, Dominic said, “No, that’s not possible.”

Marilyn rolled her eyes; Dominic had always been slow to process certain things, “How else would you explain your attraction to men, or how you instinctively crossed your legs when you took a seat earlier? Face it; the longer you’re in control the more lady-like you’ll become.” Stepping closer to Dominic, she said, “Now the choice is simple; you stay in control and see how much of a woman you can be, or you step aside and let me run the show.”

Dominic stared as his reflection in the mirror; considering for the moment that Marilyn was right. He couldn’t shake the feeling that very soon he’d be more woman than man. What if they found a way to reverse this; would he simply become a woman inside a man’s body? Turning to look at Marilyn, he said, “Y-You can take control.”

Smiling, Marilyn said, “Atta girl.”

Dominic watched as Marilyn started towards the door, “Wait, where are you going?”

“I’m returning to the real world, sweetie; my body has been unconscious on the floor for almost 5 minutes now.” Reaching for the doorknob, Marilyn said, “You’ll be staying here; walled off from pretty much everything. Which is probably for the best; because I doubt that you’ll want to see me seducing Harold.”

Running towards the door, Dominic said, “No, please don’t do that!"

“It’s too late, I’ve already made up my mind.” Stepping through the door, Marilyn said, “With any luck, I’ll be the next Mrs. Northam.”

Dominic was powerless to do anything as the door disappeared the instant Marilyn closed it.
11111212111111.title: Dominic's Life Takes a Hard Left

choices: A Short Time Later (Leaving the Hospital)
111112121111111.content:
Marci and Harold stepped out of the elevator on their way back from the cafeteria. As they walked down the hall, Marci turned to her boss and said, “What’s going to happen now, sir?” stopping in the hallway, she said, “Under the circumstances, I’d imagine Dominic wouldn’t feel comfortable returning to work.”

Harold had been thinking the same thing; along with ways to keep anyone from discovering his involvement. “Worst case scenario; Dominic is stuck like this.” Covering his mouth briefly, Harold said, “I suppose I could call in some favors; have a brand-new identity created for him, maybe even get him another position in the company.”

“Forgive me, sir; but Dominic went to school for computers, I don’t think he’d be qualified for much else.”

As they continued walking down the hall, Harold said, “I was actually thinking more in the realm of an office assistant.” Looking at Marci, Harold said, “I believe the Marketing VP is looking for a new secretary.”

“Are you kidding me?” stopping in her tracks, Marci said, “Dominic’s just had his entire life upended, and you want to give him a secretarial position?”

Arriving outside the door to Dominic’s room, Harold said, “It’s like you said, Marci; he’s not qualified for much else.”

Reaching for the doorknob, Marci said, “I’ve known Dominic since our Freshman year; I’m not sure he’d go for this.”

Suddenly the door opened, giving Marci and Harold a good look at the woman standing in the doorway. She looked every bit the consummate professional in her business suit. If Harold hadn’t known otherwise, he wouldn’t have suspected the woman standing in front of him was his daughter’s fiancé. Gesturing towards his outfit, Dominic said, “How do I look?”
111112121111111.title: Continue

111114.content:
The voice now hurling curses at the security team, most of which were variations on the Anglo-Saxon word for sexual relations, surprised Marci. She had heard Dominic talk like that once, when he spilled his coffee right on his crotch. But this voice couldn't be Dominic's, since it was too high. Downright feminine, in fact.

Curious about this development, Marci grabbed a large bath towel and stepped inside. Looking around, she saw no sign of Dominic, but she saw who had spoken to security.

This person looked a lot like Dominic, certainly. Someone who knew Dominic, but didn't know his family history, would have assumed that they were siblings. But Marci knew that he was an only child. And this certainly wasn't Dominic: he was a man, after all, and this was a woman.

"Thanks," she said. "Could you... help me with this?"

Marci tied the towel around the woman's large, shapely breasts. "That ought to do it," she said. "Now, would you mind telling me a thing or two? Like, how did you get in here? And where's Dominic?"

"That's the kicker, Marci," the woman replied. "I am Dominic."
